item.title: django-labs-accounts
item.description: django-labs-accounts is a reusable Django app to automatically set up Penn Labs accounts on our Django backends. It consists of an OAuth2 client to communicate with Platform and a user backend to log in users using Platform’s accounts.

item.title: docker-tox
item.description: docker-tox is a custom tox docker image for use within CircleCI. It is used within Penn Labs to test our PyPI packages in multiple Python environments before publishing them.

item.title: Penn Clubs
item.description: Penn Clubs is Penn Labs product to democratize information about clubs. It uses Penn Labs accounts to allow students at Penn to easily find information about clubs, their events, and applications. Penn Clubs also allows students to add themselves to clubs’ mailing lists and join clubs as members. It is built using a Django backend and a React frontend.

item.title: pfsense-to-influxdb
item.description: pfsense-to-influxdb is a metric exporter from pfSense, a software firewall, to InfluxDB, a time series database. pfsense-to-influxdb was built to allow monitoring of pfSense within Grafana, a popular dashboard for metrics.

item.title: Platform
item.description: Platform is a backend API for all of Penn Labs’ products. It is the brains of Penn Labs’ account system which allows users to login through the University of Pennsylvania’s SSO provider (Shibboleth). Platform also provides information to dynamically render our website.

item.title: Speaker Recognition Utility
item.description: As part of the New Jersey Governor’s School in the Sciences, I helped design and build a speaker recognition utility that could identify the speaker of a specific keyword from a closed set of individuals. The program used machine learning and was 100% accurate in identifying individuals.

item.title: Templates
item.description: I made a collection of templates with Penn Labs’ suggested configuration for various types of projects. These templates include configuration for testing, building, and deploying projects. As well as suggested application defaults.

item.title: Wage Tracker
item.description: I made an aggregate Wage Tracker for the US economy by reverse engineering a similar Goldman Sachs model. My model is built using the first principal component of five common wage indicators.
